FAQ.question: Why is Sub Division Number required for FMB Sketch?
FAQ.answer: Many survey numbers are split into multiple sub-plots. The Sub Division Number ensures we fetch the exact parcel instead of the parent survey map.

FAQ.question: Why do I need to select Land Type for downloading FMB?
FAQ.answer: Some survey numbers have multiple classification entries. Land Type helps fetch accurate records, especially in mixed-use or reclassified lands.

FAQ.question: Is FMB used for physical land measurement on ground?
FAQ.answer: Yes. Surveyors use FMB measurements and coordinates for field marking, fencing, and identifying boundaries on-site.

FAQ.question: Does FMB show adjacent survey plots?
FAQ.answer: Yes. FMB often shows neighboring parcel boundaries for reference along with subdivision geometry.

FAQ.question: Can FMB Sketch help verify illegal encroachments?
FAQ.answer: Yes. FMB provides exact plot dimensions which can be compared with ground measurements to detect encroachments.

FAQ.question: Is FMB mandatory for layout or building approval?
FAQ.answer: Often yes, especially for land development, layout submission, and conversion from agriculture to non-agriculture use.

FAQ.question: Does FMB show whether land is Patta or government land?
FAQ.answer: No. FMB shows geometry only. Ownership status must be verified using Patta/Chitta or EC records.

FAQ.question: Can FMB be used as proof of ownership?
FAQ.answer: No. It is a survey record. Ownership is confirmed through registered Sale Deeds and revenue records.

FAQ.question: Can FMB show water bodies or road access?
FAQ.answer: It shows boundary lines, but land-use, zoning, or hydrology checks must be done separately.

FAQ.question: Is the FMB downloaded from JaaGa authentic?
FAQ.answer: Yes. All data is sourced directly from official Tamil Nadu survey and land record systems without modification.
